This is a group of people who decided to join together 4 months ago to form this communal bank which has helped greatly to expand their businesses. They are engaged in various activities such as general trade, food sales and services, among others.
Sra. Suliana lives here. She is 33 and lives with her common-law husband with whom she has two sons, 14 and 6 years of age. They are attending high school and primary school. Her husband is a chauffeur.
Suliana is a very hard-working woman who does different things. She sells seasonal clothing of all kinds as well as natural products and she also makes clothing. She sells door to door and also in her home, where her customers come when they need an item or want her to make them a garment. Among her products, the biggest sellers are energy drinks. She has been doing this for three years and it is going very well.
She will use this loan to buy natural products, especially energy drinks. She has been in the communal bank since its inception and is the president of the group. She likes it because of the loans it provides.
Sulianas dreams are to have a large dress-making workshop and a grocery store.

loan.use: to buy energy drinks.

loan.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es: La seora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Nuevas amigas del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 45 aos de edad, est casada y tiene cinco hijos, solo uno de ellos esta a su cargo. Lleva muy poco tiempo trabajando con Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de comida, su especialidad es la venta de pollo a la lea, esta actividad la realiza en su propia casa, a partir del medio da. Tiene dos personas que la ayudan en la atencin. Con su nuevo prstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprar: 1 ciento de platos descartables, 3 sacos de carbn, servilletas, 2 docenas de platos de loza, 2 docenas de cubiertos, 2 docenas de vasos. Su esposo es docente (profesor) y es cabeza de hogar pero debido a la necesidad decidieron poner este negocio para tener un ingreso ms en el hogar, ya tienen una clientela fija que los visitan y esperan que sigan llegando ms. Con este negocio esperan que mejore la situacin econmica de su familia, porque an tienen un hijo que educar y necesitan solventar todos sus gastos. Agradecen a Manuela Ramos por brindarle los prstamos que hasta ahora les ha permitido mantener el negocio.
texts.en:
Seora Rosa is a member of the "Nuevas Amigas" ("New Friends") communal bank, which is in the District of Calleria, in the Department of Ucayali. She is 45 years old, and is married with five children; only one of them is still at home.
She has been working with Manuela Ramos for a very short time, and works selling food. Her specialty is selling rotisserie chicken, which she makes in her own home, beginning at noon. She has two people who help her with serving customers.
With this new loan of 1,500 New Soles, she will buy: 100 disposable plates, 3 bags of charcoal, napkins, 2 dozen earthenware plates, 2 dozen silverware settings, 2 dozen glasses.
Her husband is a teacher, and is the head of the household. However, owing to necessity, they decided to start this business to earn some more household income. They have a loyal customer base who visit them and they hope that they more will continue to come.
They hope to improve their family's financial situation with this business, as they still have a son to educate, and they need to cover all of his expenses. They are grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing them with the loans, which have allowed them to keep their business going up to this point.

loan.use: to buy charcoal, disposable plates, glasses, etc.

loan.name: Eloisa

texts.es: La seora Elosa es socia del banco comunal Los Manguitos del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 54 aos D. edad, est casada y tien cinco hijos, solo uno D. sus hijos se encuentra a su cargo. Es fundadora D. este banco comunal, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catlogo y lo viene haciendo desD. hace muchos aos. Su prstamo inicial fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles. Con su nuevo prstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprar: 3 shampoo, 2 talcos, 2 cremas para manos, 2 perfumes para damas, 2 lpiz labiales, 2 lpiz delineadores, 1 crema liporeductora, 3 perfumes para hombres. Su esposo es mecnico D. profesin y es el que mantiene el hogar, los ingresos que genera con la venta D. sus productos son para ella y lo distribuye como lo crea conveniente, D. sta forma ayuda econmicamente a su esposo. Manuela Ramos le ayudo para comenzar su negocio y est contenta porque tiene su pequeo capital y lo est sabiendo invertir.
texts.en:
Elosa is a member of the 'Los Manguitos' community bank which is located in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department. She is 54 years old, married, and has five children. Only one of her children is still in her care. Elosa is a founding member of her community bank. Her business is selling beauty products through a catalog and she has been in the business for many years. Her initial loan was for 300 soles.
With this new loan for 1,500 soles, Elosa will buy: 3 lots of shampoo, 2 lots of talcum powder, 2 lots of handcream, 2 lots of ladies' perfume, 2 lots of lipsticks, 2 lots of lip pencils, 1 lot of lipo-reduction cream and three lots of men's perfume.
Elosa's husband is a mechanic by traD. and he supports their household. The income that Elosa makes from selling her products is for her and she uses it as she sees fit. In this way, she helps her husband financially.
Manuela Ramos helped Elosa to start her business and she is happy because she has her small amount of capital and she is investing it wisely.

loan.use: to buy talcum powder and creams

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to expand the store and stock up on merchandise ( popsicles and gelatin ).

loan.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen tiene 37 aos, es una mujer muy activa y trabajadora, casada y madre de dos hijos, de 05 y 03 aos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. Karen se dedica a la elaboracin de buffets, no tiene una empresa formal, pero tiene pedidos de algunas entidades para eventos, como: aniversarios, acontecimientos sociales. Menciona que la pocas donde hay ms clientes es en diciembre, cuando hay graduaciones de los colegios o de instituciones publicas y privadas. El servicio que brinda es de calidad, ya que siempre le dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo en este trabajo, en el que lleva cinco aos. Hoy cuenta con la ayuda de dos seoras ms para que la ayuden en la preparacin de la comida. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que solo lo dedica el fin de semana, teniendo tiempo libre para cuidar de sus hijos. Anhela en un futuro formalizar su negocio y expandirse, por ello este ser su segundo crdito con MFP, y del cual espera el apoyo de todos ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprar algunos utensilios entre ollas de barro e implementar materiales e ingrediente para tener todo lo que le pidan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Karen is 37 years old, and is a very active and hard-working woman. She is married, and is the mother of two children aged 5 and 3. They live together in their own home.
Karen works preparing buffet meals. She doesn't have a formal business, but takes orders from several entities for events such as anniversaries and other social events. She mentions that the time of year when she has most customers is December, when there are graduations from high-schools and public and private institutions.
She provides a quality service, as she commits the main part of her time to this work, which she has been doing for five years. Today she has the help of two more ladies, who help her prepare the food.
What she likes about her work is that she only works weekends, giving her free time to spend with her children. She hopes in the future to formalize her business and expand it, and this is the reason for her second loan with MFP, which she hopes all of you will help with.
With the requested amount, she will buy several utensils including clay pots, and use her materials and ingredients to be able to meet all her customers' orders.

loan.use: to buy clay pots and kitchen supplies, also ingredients.

loan.name: Nueva Amistad De Huascar Group

texts.es: La Alcancia Comunal "NUEVA AMISTAD DE HUASCAR" vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por casi 8 aos, este grupo est formado por 8 personas, quienes elegieron como presidenta a la seora Clemencia La Seora Clemencia es una persona muy trabajadora, con carisma y responsabilidad, que se dedica a la elaboracion de aretes, collares, pulseras de forma artesanal, tiene clientes fijos a los cuales vende al por mayor. Clemencia ha sabido salir adelante pues es madre soltera de 4 hijos, a quienes ha tratado de dar las comodidades que se merecen, dos de sus hijos actualmente aun dependen de ella ya que son menores de edad, ella suea con hacer crecer su negocio y llegar a a exportar sus productos.
texts.en:
The Nueva Amistad de Huascar (New Friendship of Huascar) Communal Bank has worked with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for almost 8 years. The group is made up of 8 people who have elected Clemencia as their president.
Clemencia is a very hard-working person, with charisma and responsibility, who is dedicated to making artisan earrings, necklaces, and bracelets. She has a set group of customers to whom she sells the majority of her work.
Clemencia has understood the necessity of getting ahead, since she is a single mother with 4 children for whom she has tried to provide the comforts they deserve. Two of her children are still minors and dependent on her. Clemencia dreams of making her business grow and of reaching the point where she can export her products.

loan.use: to buy materials to make artisan products to sell.

loan.name: Jovita

texts.es: La seora Jovita es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Horizonte del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 53 aos de edad, es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos, solo uno vive con ella. Lleva trabajando 10 aos con los prstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y lo realiza con mucho agrado porque tiene ya una clientela fija que hizo en todos estos aos. Con su nuevo prstamo de S/. 3,000.00 soles comprar: productos diversos que necesita para poder surtir su stock de productos, los mismos que exhibe en su vitrina, aprovecha las ofertas que son las que le brindan ms ganancias, con ste dinero comprar: 8 perfumes de hombres, accesorios, 1 crema para ojeras, 4 cremas para el cuerpo, 3 perfumes de mujer, 2 cremas apara mano, 2 callares, 2 delineadores lquidos, 2 rubores, 1 rimer, cuarteto de sombras. Ella invierte todo su prstamo en la compra de su mercadera porque a fin de mes recibe los pagos de sus clientes a quines venda a crdito. Jovita est muy contenta porque hasta ahora ha podido conservar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jovita is a member of the communal group Nuevo Horizonte ( New Horizon ), located in the district of Calleria a department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old, widowed, and has four children, one of which lives with her.
She has been working with loans from the field partner, Manuela Ramos, for 10 years. She sells beauty products and does so with happiness because she has an established clientele that she has built throughout the years.
With her new loan of 3,000 soles she'll purchase diverse products that she needs to stock her line; the same products displayed in the showcase. She takes advantage of sales since these are what bring her the most profits. With the money she plans on purchasing: 8 men's colognes, accessories, 1 eye cream for dark circles, 4 body creams, 3 perfumes, 2 hand creams, 2 necklaces, 2 liquid eyeliners, 2 units of blush, mascara, and a quartet of eye shadow. She invest her entire loan towards the purchase of merchandise because she receives payment at the end of the month from clients she sells to on credit. Jovita is very happy because she has been able to maintain her business this far.

loan.use: to purchase perfumes, powders, etc.

loan.name: Rodrigo Denys

texts.es: El Sr. Rodrigo es cliente nuevo de la institucin, ser su primer crdito el es soltero vive en la casa de su Mama la Sra. Rosario ambos viven en la zona de el tejar de la ciudad de La Paz, La Sra. rosario se dedica a la venta de medicamentos naturales y productos farmacuticos , Y el Sr. Rodrigo se dedica a la venta CD y DVD de msica y pelculas en las distintas ferias de la ciudad de La paz , el crdito lo destinara para la compra de un televisor, ya que ser uno de sus instrumentos de trabajo, es una persona joven con ganas de superacin con el tiempo desea poder tener su internet propio, el cliente se siente beneficiado con el crdito Kiva y muy agradecido con la institucin por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is a new client of the institution, and this will be his first loan. He is single, and he lives with his mother, Rosario. They live in the weaving zone of the city of La Paz.
Rosario sells natural medications and pharmaceutical products. Rodrigo sells CDs, music DVDs, and movies at the different fairs in the city of La Paz.
The loan is to buy a television because it will be one of his work tools. He is a young man who is determined to succeed, and he wants to open his own Internet cafe in the future.
He feels he has benefited from the Kiva loan, and he is very grateful to the institution for the support they provided.

loan.use: to buy a television.

loan.name: Leyli

texts.es: Leily de 52 aos, es una mujer alegre y dinmica, convive con su pareja y es madre de dos hijos, de 15 y 13 aos, a quienes desea darles una buena educacin y alimentacin. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de pescado, este trabajo lo realiza en un pequeo mercado de su ciudad. Tiene diez aos realizando esta actividad, de los tiene siente aos en este mismo mercado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que trabaja a medio tiempo, es decir por las maana vende y por las tardes se dedica a sus hijos para ayudarlos con las tareas del colegio. Este ser el segundo crdito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continaur desarrollando su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprar materiales de pesca, pues tiene en mente salir ella misma a pescar para no tener que pagar inetermediarios que le porveen el pescado.
texts.en: Leily, 52, is a cheerful, dynamic woman who lives with her common-law husband and two children, ages 15 and 13. She wants to provide them with good food and a proper education. Her business is selling fish in the small city market. She has been in this activity for ten years, seven of which have been in this same market. What she enjoys most about her work is the fact that it is part time only. She works in the morning and helps her children with their homework in the afternoons. This is her second loan through MFP and she counts on your help so she can keep working. She plans to use the loan to buy fishing supplies so she can go out fishing on her own and not have to pay the intermediary suppliers.

loan.use: To buy fishing supplies.

loan.name: Emprendedoras Yvyra Pyta Group

texts.es: El comit Ybyra pyta est situado en la ciudad de Curuguaty, est conformado por 12 integrantes. Este comit se encuentra en el segundo ciclo, estn aprendiendo la importancia de trabajar en equipo dentro de un grupo con responsabilidad, honestidad y comunicacin. Demuestran conciencia por el compromiso asumido con el comit como tambin con la Fundacin Paraguaya que les ha brindado una oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de vida a travs del trabajo y la integracin grupal incentivando as tambin el ahorro de cada una de ellas con el nico objetivo de crecimiento econmico suyas y la de su comunidad. Una de las miembros es la seora Zulma, ella se dedica a la cra y venta de animales. Por medio de este arduo trabajo ella ha podido mantener a su familia y sacarlos adelante. Comenta que este es un trabajo muy duro, pues debe estar al pendiente de que a los animales no les pase nada y cuidarlos de enfermedades. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de animales, como as tambin para alimentos de los mismos. Agradece a la Fundacin por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues de obtener el crdito le ser de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Yvyra Pyta committee consists of 12 members and is located in the city of Curuguaty. The committee is in it's second loan cycle. The members are learning the importance of group teamwork with responsibility, honesty and communication. They have demonstrated awareness of the commitment they have made to the committee and also to the Fundacin Paraguaya, which has provided them with an opportunity to improve the quality of life through work, encouraging group integration, and also helping each member with the sole purpose of economic growth for themselves and their community.
One of the members is Mrs. Zulma, who breeds and sells animals. Through her hard work she has been able to sustain and raise her family. She says that her work is very hard as she needs to make sure that the animals are always safe and well looked after, and also take care of diseases. She has requested this loan to purchase more animals, as well as food for them. She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity they have provided, as obtaining this loan will help her very much.

loan.use: to purchase animals and food for them

loan.name: Tereza De Jesus

texts.es: Doa Tereza labora como docente y comercializa productos de cosmetico Avon, para lograr su estabilidad economica, como el apoyo a su familia, su esposo labora como conductor y sus cuatro hijos estudian. Tereza ha venido mejorando su casa, con financiamiento en Afodenic, lo que para ella ha sido de gran logro al poder dar una mejor vivienda a sus hijos, pues todo esta ha altos costos y es por este medio que se avanza mas, ya que son ah plazos, pudiendo equilibrar sus gastos. Con este nuevo prestamo sera para la construccion de pared de concreto interna para lograr mejor privacidad. Materiales a comprar bloques, arena, hierro, cemento, tablas entre otros materiales para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Doa Tereza works as a teacher and sells Avon cosmetic products to stabilize her economy and support the family. Her husband works as a driver and her four children are in school.
Through loans from Afodenic, Tereza has been making home improvements in order to give her children a better home environment. Since materials are expensive the loans have allowed her to pay over time and balance her expenses.
The new loan will be used to build an indoor concrete wall for more privacy. The materials required to begin the project are blocks, sand, iron, cement and boards.

loan.use: To build a wall for more privacy.

loan.name: Rieles Group

texts.es: El grupo Rieles est conformado por las siguientes personas: Don Felipe, Doa Celia, Doa Mara del Carmen, ellos son de una comida pequea pero con mucha cultura y costumbres la comunidad se caracteriza por ser tranquila donde sus habitantes son personas campesinas, obreras u comerciantes. Le pusieron este nombre de los Rieles porque ellos viven cerca donde estn unos rieles y porque siempre han vivido ah, ellos saben que por ah pasaba el tren desde hace mucho tiempo eso fue lo que les cuentan sus antepasados, sin embargo, los riles cayeron y ahora estn en mal estado claro ah ya no circula ningn tren pero ah siguen los rieles. Don Felipe quien es el representante comenta: "desde que recuerdo lo rieles han estado ah, entonces cuando nos preguntaron qu nombre le queramos poner al grupo decidimos ponerle Rieles" l tiene 47 aos de edad, esta casado con la seora Mara Carmen desde hace 26 aos, ahora ninguno de sus hijos depende de ellos ya que todos se casaron y viven aparte. Solicito el crdito para comprar 6 cerditos los cuales los conocemos como los famosos lechones, en casa tiene cuatro cerditas, y un semental, en su actividad ganadera tiene de experiencia 15 aos. Comenta por el momento no tiene ningn problema, ni siquiera que sus cerdos se enfermen ya que el prefiere comprar lechones y no de granja ya que los de granja son muy delicados al frio y no estn acostumbrados al campo todo lo contrario a los lechones no se enferman aunque estn en el frio y si se les quiere sacar a pastar al campo no pasa nada. Aunque en su casa tiene sus corrales bien construidos tiene 6 los cuales su meta ser llenarlos todos de puerquitos lechones, ya que acaba de vender unos. Y se ha quedado casi sin cerdos. Don Felipe le da las gracias a FRAC Gracias por el prstamo porque le ayuda de mucho de ya que sus cerditos a mantenerlos sanos y fuertes
texts.en:
The group "Rieles" consists of the following people: Don Felipe, Doa Celia, Doa Mara del Carmen. They are from a small community but one that has a lot of culture and many customs. The area is noted for it serenity where the inhabitants are farm labourers, workers or traders.
They named the group "Rieles" because they live near some railway tracks and have always lived there. They know that the train used go by there a long time ago according to their ancestors. However, the tracks fell apart and now are in poor condition. Ofcourse no train runs there now but the tracks remain.
Don Felipe ,the group representative says "Ever since I can remember the tracks have been there. So when they asked us what we wanted to name the group we decided to call it "Rieles" (tracks)". He is 47 years old and has been married to Seora Mara Carmen for the last 26 years. None of their children are dependents now as they are all married and live on their own.
He is asking for a loan to buy 6 suckling piglets. At home he has 4 female piglets and a stud. He has been breeding livestock for 15 years.
He says that at the moment he has no problem not even his pigs becoming sick. He says this is because he prefers to buy suckling pigs rather than from a farm as the ones from the farm are very sensitive to the cold and are not used to the countryside. The suckling pigs are the complete opposite never getting sick even if left in the cold and they are fine even if taken out to graze in the fields.
Although he has well-constructed corrals at home, he has 6 he means to fill with suckling pigs as he just sold some and has almost no pigs left. Don Felipe gives his thanks to FRAC, "Thank you for the loan because it helps me keep my piglets healthy and strong."

loan.use: to buy 6 suckling pigs.

loan.name: Marcelino Group

texts.es: El grupo M. est conformado por las siguientes personas: Don Jess, Doa Juana, Don Fidencio y Doa Andrea. Decidieron ponerle as ya que son familiares y llevan el apellido M.. El seor Jess quien es el representante del grupo comenta que es la primera vez que estn en el crdito esperan que les valla muy bien ya que necesitan mucho la ayuda para mejorar su calidad de vida por medio de sus negocios y actividades. Don Jess tiene 27 aos est casado con la seora Andrea desde hace 10 aos juntos han procreado tres hijos, Jacqueline de 8 aos quien est cursando cuarto grado de primaria, Paola de 6 aos cursa primero de primaria, Jos Antonio de 4 aos de primaria l se encuentra en segundo ao en el preescolar. El seor Jess inicio el negocio porque se le hace muy pesado pagar las colegiaturas de sus hijos adems el tambin est estudiando un curso de computacin ya que considera importante seguir preparndose para la vida. Don Jess tiene un negocio de ropa interior en el negocio lleva 10 aos, el negocio lo pone tres das a la semana los sbados, domingos y lunes es un puesto que lo pone en el mercado de su comunidad estos das son los que se realiza el tianguis por eso el aprovecha para ganar algo de dinero. Esta vez ha solicitado el crdito para comprar calcetines, calcetas, ropa intima para dama y caballero. Ya que el problema que presenta en estos momentos es la competencia que tiene entonces considera importante, tener ropa ntima novedosa y aun mejor precio para que tenga ms clientes, ya que los clientes lo que buscan es precios bajos y la calidad de la ropa. En dado caso su meta seria mejorar la calidad de su producto pero tambin dar un mejor precio para aumentar la clientela. Los restantes del grupo invertirn el crdito en otras actividades como doa Juana comprara plsticos y productos de mercera, don Fidencio comprara fantasas y juguetes, Andrea invertir en la compra de ropa de bebe.
texts.en:
The group M. consists of the following people: Don Jess, Doa Juana, Don Fidencio and Doa Andrea. They decided to so name the group because they are family and all bear the surname M..
Seor Jess who is the group representative says that it is the first time they have a loan and they hope that it goes very well as they really need the help to improve their quality of life by means of their businesses and activities.
Don Jess is 27 years old and has been married to Senora Andrea for 10 years. Together they have 3 children: Jacqueline who is 8 and in the 4th grade, Paola who is 6 and in 1st grade and Jose Antonio who is 4 and in the 2nd year of pre-school.
Seor Jess started his business because he finds it very hard to pay for his children's schooling. In addition he is also studying a computer course as he thinks it is important to continue learning for life.
Don Jess has had an underwear business for 10 years. He runs the business 3 days a week: Saturdays, Sundays and Mondays. He has a stall at the local market on these days as the open air market takes place then and it is easier to make some money.
This time he is asking for a loan to buy socks, stockings, underwear for ladies and men. As the problem he currently has is competition, he thinks that it is important to stock the latest underwear at better prices so that he attracts more customers as customers look for low prices and good quality clothing.
In this case, his goal is to improve the quality of his product as well as offer a better price to increase his number of customers.
The rest of the group will invest their loans in other activities for example: Doa Juana will buy plastic products and haberdashery; Don Fidencio will buy fantasies and toys. Andrea will invest in buying babies' clothing.

loan.use: to buy ladies' and men's underwear, socks and stockings.

loan.name: Sidlia

texts.es:
Sidlia es socia del Banco Comunal "Las Moralinas del distrito Morales en el departamento de San Martn. Es soltera, tiene 49 aos y tres hijos, entre 18 y 22 aos que le apoyan en su negocio y tambin en casa.
Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas en la entrada de su casa. Su negocio opera tres das a la semana, desde el jueves hasta el sbado. A veces prepara comida como asaditos y pollo.
El nuevo prstamo de S/. 1,800.00 lo invertir en la compra de nuevas bebidas de variados sabores y marcas. Dice que est muy bien, aunque le gustara tener un piso ms arreglado par poner un local de venta de ropa.
Lleva tres aos con Manuela Ramos y le agradece la oportunidad de recibir un prstamo con tanta rapidz.
texts.en:
Sidlia is a member of the communal bank "Las Moralinas" in the district of Morales, department of San Martn. She is single, 49, and has three children between the ages of 18 and 22 who help in the business and at home.
She sells sodas at the entrance to her house. He business is open three days a week, from Thursday to Saturday. Sometimes she prepares food such as small roasts and chicken.
The new loan in the amount of 1,800 PEN will be used to buy new beverages in a variety of flavors and brands. Although she claims her life is alright, she would like to have a nicer apartment so she could set up a clothes shop.
She has been working with Manuela Ramos for three years and is grateful for the opportunity to receive a loan so quickly.

loan.use: To buy beverages.

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 43 aos y es socia del Banco Comunal "Mujeres Valerosas II del distrito Tarapoto en el departamento de San Martn. Est casada y tiene 3 hijos. Su pareja le ayuda en la preparacin de la comida que vende por las noches de forma ambulatoria.
Tiene este negocio desde hace 13 aos, ella preparan y vende juanes, humitas, pescado asado y muchos platos de la regin. Con Manuela Ramos lleva trabajando cinco aos. Con el nuevo prstamo de S/. 800.00 comprar ollas y una mquina de moler. Su objetivo es que todos sus hijos sean profesionales, como dice... esa es la motivacin de su trabajo.
Lo que le gusta de Manuela Ramos es la oportunidad de recibir un prstamo con bajos interes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 and a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Valerosas II" from the Tarapoto District in the department of San Martn. She is married and has three children. Her partner helps prepare the food she sells as a food vendor at night.
She has been in business for 13 years, selling "juanes", "humitas", baked fish and many regional dishes. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for five years.
The new loan in the amount of 800 PEN will be used to by pots and a grinder. Her goal is for her children to become professionals since, as she says, that is her main reason for working.
What she likes most about Manuela Ramos is the opportunity to receive low-interest loans.

loan.use: To buy pots and a grinder.

loan.name: Maria Luzmila

texts.es:
Mara tiene 58 aos es casada y tiene 8 hijos los cuales tienen 36, 32, 30, 27, 25, 20, 22 y 17 aos de edad. Vive con su familia en Otavalo. Se describe como una persona sencilla y muy alegre.
Mara trabaja con su familia en la elaboracin de bolsos y tapices artesanales. Es la primera vez que trabaja con Fodemi y el crdito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima lo que es hilo de lana para la elaboracin de los bolsos y tapices; lo cual ayudara a mejorar su produccin, sus ventas y sus ingresos, de esta manera poder ayudar a su familia economicamente.
texts.en:
Mara, 58, is married and has eight children, ages 36, 32, 30, 27, 25, 22, 20 and 17. She lives with her family in Otavalo and describes herself as a simple, cheerful person.
Mara and her family make handmade bags and tapestries. This is her first loan through Fodemi and she plans to use it to buy raw materials such as yarn for the bags and tapestries she makes. This will help improve production and sales which will increase her income so she can support her family economically.

loan.use: To buy yarn.

loan.name: Familia Con Suerte (Manta) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familia Con Suerte se rene cada 15 das en el barrio Miraflores en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda poca del ao y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos tursticos.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crdito que les va a servir de mucho ya que con los crditos ellos mejoran sus pequeos negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como, comercio en general, venta de comida, servicios entre otras actividades.
En este lugar conocimos a la seora Ludis, tiene 32 aos, casada y de esta relacin tienen dos hijos de 10 y 7 aos de edad que estudian en la escuela. Su esposo es supervisor en una fbrica en Manta.
Ella es una gran ama de casa que adems de estar al tanto de todas las necesidades de su hogar y de sus pequeos hijos tambin se dedica al comercio con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos, ella vende arroz por quintales, en su casa vende muchos quintales de arroz a sus clientes ya que este es un producto indispensable en los hogares del pas, recibe directamente el arroz desde las piladoras y luego vende a sus clientes y les da facilidades de pago ya que deja a crdito y cobra cada semana, lleva 2 aos dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien, le gusta ya que se gana un dinero sin tener que descuidar a sus pequeos hijos.
Este crdito es para comprar quintales de arroz, este es su primer crdito en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los crditos.
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y con el banco.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Familia Con Suerte" meets every 15 days in the Miraflores neighborhood of the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many in all seasons of the year, and for being a city with unparalleled beauty and many tourist attractions. This group of people decided to unite and form this communal bank so that they could get loans to improve their small businesses, which will help them a lot. The members have a variety of businesses including: general retail sales, food sales, services, and other activities.
Here we meet Ludis, 32, who is married and has two children aged 10 and 7 who are in school. Her husband is a supervisor in a factory in Manta.
Ludis is a great housewife who, along with carrying out the household chores and caring for her small children, also has a business which allows her to generate her own income. She sells rice by the quintal (hundred pound sacks.) She sells a lot of quintals of rice to her customers from her house, because this is a staple product in the households of her country. She receives the rice directly from the rice mills, and later sells it to her customers. She provides her customers with payment terms, since she sells on credit, and she collects every week. She has been doing this work for 2 years, and it is going very well. She likes it because she earns money without having to neglect her small children.
This loan will be used to buy 100-pound sacks of rice. This is her first loan with the communal bank. She is the president of her communal bank, and she likes it because of how quickly the loans are disbursed.
Her goals are to continue to make progress with her business and with her communal bank.

loan.use: to buy 100-pound sacks of rice

loan.name: Salustina Vicenta

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Amor Y Paz se rene cada quince das en la parroquia Caldern de la ciudad de Portoviejo, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cra de animales y a la venta de sus productos.
La seora Salustina es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque sus compaeras son muy unidas y se divierte en las reuniones. Tiene 53 aos de edad y mantiene una relacin de unin libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos, dos hijas aun viven con ella una de ellas est casada y vive con su esposo y dos hijos pequeos que son la alegra de nuestra amiga. El marido se dedica a la agricultura y cra de animales.
Nuestra amiga a ms de ser una gran ama de casa tambin se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Tambin ella compra man lo procesa y luego lo distribuye molido a comerciantes de su zona o lo lleva a entregar a la ciudad de Portoviejo donde cuenta con buena clientela. Trabaja todos los das, lo que es ropa la deja a crdito y cobra cada quince das pero el man cobra en efectivo ya que son ventas ms lejanas. Lleva 11 aos que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crdito lo va emplear en comprar ms mercadera como: pantalones, blusas, ropa de nios y man para procesarlo y venderlo.
Sus sueos son seguir adelante en su negocio y en el banco.
texts.en:
The "Amor Y Paz" ("Love and Peace") Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Caldern parish in Portoviejo city. This is an area where people mainly work in agriculture, livestock and selling products.
Seora Salustina is a founding member of the Communal Bank, which she likes because her colleagues are very united and she enjoys the meetings. She is 53 years old, and has a common-law marriage with four children: two daughters still live with her, one of them is married and lives with her husband and two small children, who are the joy of our friend's life. Her husband works in agriculture and livestock.
In addition to managing the household, our friend also works selling all types of clothes, which she does door-to-door. She also buys peanuts which she processes and grinds, and later distributes to the retailers in her area, or she takes them to Portoviejo city where she has a good customer base.
She works every day. She provides credit for her clothes, which she collects on every two weeks, but she charges cash for her peanut sales as they are further away. She has been doing this work for 11 years, and it's going very well for her.
She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as trousers, blouses, children's clothing and peanuts for processing and selling.
Her dreams are to continue moving ahead with her business and with the bank.

loan.use: to buy trousers, blouses, children's clothing and peanuts.

loan.name: Ludith

texts.es:
Ludith tiene 45 aos, es socia D. Banco Comunal "Las Orquideas D. distrito de Tarapoto D. departamento de San Martn. Est casada y tiene tres hijos de 15, 20 y 28 aos de edad. La mayor ya no vive en casa y estudia agronoma.
Fue idea propia de empezar su negocio de confeccin de lencera y se dedica a ste negocio desde hace 10 aos. El capital inicial fue de S/. 300.00. Desde entonces se estabiliz muy bien y dice que es muy conocida en su barrio. Durante todo el da su clientela le encuentra en su taller donde vende tambin sus prendas. Con ste prstamo de S/. 3,000.00 comprar telas, hilos y blondas al por mayor. Ludith tiene dos sueos, primero tener un negocio ms grande y segundo dedicarse tambin a otros negocios para incrementar sus ingresos.
Desde hace 8 aos es socia de Manuela Ramos y lo que ms le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los talleres que imparten los mismos que animan a las mujeres de ser independientes y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ludith is 45 years old and a member of Las Orquideas (The Orchids) Communal Bank in the district of Tarapoto, in San Martin department. She is married and has 3 children, aged 15, 20, and 28. The majority no longer live at home they are studying agronomy.
It was Ludith's own idea to begin a lingerie-making business, and she has been dedicated to this activity for some 10 years now. Her initial capital investment was just 300 sols. Since then, the business has become well established and it seems that Ludith is well known in her barrio. All day long her clientele will find her in her workshop where she also sells her garments.
With this loan of 3,000 sols, Ludith will buy cloth, thread, and blond lace at wholesale. She has 2 dreams; the 1st is to have a larger business, and the 2nd is to begin other businesses in order to increase her income.

loan.use: to buy blond lace, cloth and thread for making lingerie to sell.

loan.name: Paula Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Amor Y Paz se rene cada quince das en la parroquia Caldern de la ciudad de Portoviejo, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cra de animales y a la venta de sus productos.
En este lugar conocimos a la seora Paula tiene 38 aos de edad, est casada y de esta relacin tiene 3 hijos, el mayor estudia en la Universidad y los dos menores estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Nuestra amiga se dedica junto a su esposo y sus hijos a la agricultura y a la venta de sus productos, cultivan pltano, yuca y man. Nos cuenta que cuando sus productos estn de cosecha los entregan a comerciantes que llegan hasta la zona a comprar y tambin los llevan a Manta, Chone y Portoviejo. Ellos tambin venden los derivados de estos como el almidn el mismo que entregan en las ciudades antes mencionadas. Trabajan en el campo desde las 07h00 hasta las 15h00, adems de ellos tambin en pocas de duro trabajo contratan otras tres personas a quienes les pagan un sueldo semanal por su labor.
Este nuevo crdito lo va a utilizar en comprar insecticidas e insumos para la agricultura. Est en el Banco Comunal desde el principio, es socia fundadora y le gusta por la ayuda que ha recibido.
Sus metas son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The 'Amor y Paz' (Love and Peace) community bank meets once every two weeks in Caldern parish, in the city of Portoviejo. Most of the people in this area farm, raise animals, and sell their products.
Here we meet 38-year-old Paula who is married and has three children from her marriage. Her eldest is studying at university and the two younger children are in high school. Her husband is a farmer.
Our friend farms together with her husband and children. She also sells their crops. They grow bananas, cassava and peanuts. She tells us that when their crops are harvested, they sell them to traders who come to their area to buy. They also take them to Manta, Chone and Portoviejo. In addition, they sell derivatives of their crops, such as starch, which they deliver to the above-mentioned cities. They work in the fields from 7.00am to 3.00pm. At times of the year when there is a lot of hard work, they also hire another three people who they pay a weekly wage for their work.
Paula will use this new loan to buy insecticides and farming supplies. She has been a member of her community bank from the beginning: she is a founding member. She enjoys belonging to the bank because of the help that she has received.
Paula's goal is for her children to finish their studies and become professionals.

loan.use: to buy insecticides and farming supplies

loan.name: Sulmira

texts.es:
Sulmira tiene 49 aos y es socia del Banco Comunal "Nuestra Seora de la Paz del distrito Tarapoto del departamento San Martn. Est casada y tiene 2 hijos. Como tiene que viajar a Lima frecuentemente por razones de salud, su esposo ha dejado su trabajo para dedicarse al negocio, ellos tienen una bodega que est abierta todo el da.
Cuando sus nios eran pequeos, Sulmira decidi poner un negocio en que ella podiera estar al lado de la casa y vigilar a sus hijos. Hace 25 aos que Sulmira empez de vender diversos artculos en forma ambulatoria al frente de su casa, hoy en da tiene una bodega bien establecida y la gente dice que tiene suerte con su ubicacin. Espera mucho que uno/a de sus hijos se dedique a ella y mantener el negocio familiar. El nuevo prstamo de S/. 2,000.00 lo va a invertir en la compra de nuevos productos como detergente, bebidas, verduras y productos de beleza.
A ella le gusta mucho reunirse con sus amigas del Banco Comunal cada mes en su casa para las reuniones y pasarlo "chvere. Agradece a Manuela Ramos todo el apoyo durante los 12 aos que est como socia y se siente parte de la familia.
texts.en:
Sulmira is 49 years old and a member of the "Nuestra Seora de la Paz (Our Lady of Peace) community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martn department. She is married and has two children. As she frequently has to travel to Lima for health reasons, her husband has left his job in order to devote himself to the business. They have a grocery store which is open all day long.
When her children were young, Sulmira decided to set up a business which would enable her to be at home and watch over her children. 25 years ago, she started selling a range of items as an itinerant street vendor in front of her house. She now has a well-established grocery store and people say that she is lucky because of its location.
Sulmira really hopes that one of her children will work in the family business and keep it going.
Sulmira will invest her new loan for 2,000 soles in buying new products such as detergents, drinks, vegetables and beauty products.
Sulmira really enjoys meeting with her friends from the community bank each month. They hold their meetings in her house and have a great time. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for all the support she has received over the 12 years in which she has been a member. She feels part of the family.

loan.use: to buy detergents, drinks, vegetables and beauty products

loan.name: Lita

texts.es: Lita, de 39 aos, es una mujer alegre y emprendedora, es madre soltera de un hijo que ya es mayor y vive solo, ella tiene su casa propia donde vive sola e intenta realizar la mayor cantidad de actividades posibles para que pueda estar ocupada. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de comida en la vereda de su casa, ella se levanta desde muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar todos los productos necesarios y empezar a preparar los deliciosos potajes que muchos de sus clientes le solicitan. Tiene 8 aos trabajando y considera que le gusta relacionarse con la gente, y ms si eso le conlleva ganancias. Por ahora le esta yendo bien en su trabajo, ya que sus ingresos diarios no bajan del 50 % de ganancia de acuerdo a su inversin, adems tiene clientes todo el tiempo, por ello espera mantenerse en ese mismo ritmo de trabajo.Este ser el quinto crdito con MFP, y por tanto desea que ustedes la apoyen para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprar ingredientes y materiales para la elaboracin de sus deliciosos platos.
texts.en:
39-year-old Lita is a cheerful and entrepreneurial woman. She is a single mother and has one son who is grown up and lives alone. Lita owns her own home. She lives alone and tries to carry out as many activities as possible in order to keep busy.
Lita sells meals on the sidewalk outside her home. She gets up very early in the morning to go to the market and buy all the products she needs to start preparing the delicious stews that many of her customers ask for. She has been working for 8 years and she says that she enjoys interacting with people, even more so if it makes her profits. For now, she is doing well in her work as her daily income doesn't fall below 50% profits in relation to her investment. In addition, she always has customers. She hopes to keep going at this same work rate.
This will be Lita's fifth loan from MFP and she would like you to support her so that she can continue investing in her business. She will use the sum she has requested to buy ingredients and supplies for making her delicious dishes.

loan.use: to buy ingredients and cooking supplies

loan.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila, de 42 aos, es conviviente con su pareja con quien es madre de seis hijos de 24, 22, 20, 17, 15 y 7 aos, que aun viven con ella y aun cuatro dependen de ella para su alimentacin y educacin, ella tiene una casa propia donde vive junto a sus seis hijos y su pareja. Lucila tiene como trabajo el de la venta de comida, sal por las tardes a la vereda de su casa donde con la ayuda de sus hijos coloca una mesa larga, la parrilla, el asador y las bancas, despus atiza su carbn e inicia con la jornada de venta de asados, Juanes, tacacho, etc, como es de buena sazn tiene muchos clientes que le son fieles por que siempre les da con una pequea yapa, lleva trabajando ya un ao y esta contenta por que le esta yendo bien y as puede generar ganancias en su hogar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que por las maana puede utilizar su tiempo para otras actividades que tambin son fundamentales para sus ingresos, tiene clientes todos los das ya que esta ubicada en un lugar muy accesible para el publico, espera mas adelante poner su restaurante y as empezar a ser mas formal. Este ser el prstamo numero 13 con la institucin MFP, espera poder seguir trabajando juntos ya que es mucha ayuda para lo que ha logrado hasta ahora, tiene un lindo grupo y como es una socia antigua tiene un respaldo grande de las dems socias. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, alquilara un local para que empiece a vender men y as empezar a ser parte de la formalidad a parte de empezar a generar mas ingresos durante el da.
texts.en:
42-year-old Lucila lives with her partner. She has six children aged 24, 22, 20, 17, 15 and 7 who still live with her. Four of them are still dependent on her for their food and education. Lucila owns her own home where she lives together with her six children and her partner.
Lucila sells meals for a living. She goes out to the sidewalk outside her house every afternoon and, with the help of her children, she sets up a large table, grill, spit and benches. She stokes her charcoal and starts her day selling roasted meats, 'juanes' (a Peruvian chicken dish), 'tacacho' (a Peruvian dish of fried plantain mashed with pork rind), etc. As her food is very tasty, she has a lot of customers who are loyal to her business and she always gives them a little extra.
Lucila has been working in this business for a year and she is happy because it is doing well and she is able to make money for her household. What she enjoys about her work is the fact that she can use her time in the mornings to carry out other activities which are also essential for her income and she has customers every day as her business is located in a place which is easily accessible to the public. She hopes, in the future, to set up a restaurant and thereby start running a more formal business.
This will be Lucila's 13th loan from MFP and she hopes to be able to continue working together as it is very helpful to her and has helped her to achieve all she has up to now. She has a lovely loan group and, as she is a long-standing member, she has a lot of support from her fellow group members. Lucila will use the 2,500 soles she has requested to rent premises so that she can start selling meals and working more formally, as well as making more income during the day.

loan.use: to rent premises for her business

loan.name: Florecilda Aracely

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Amor y Paz se rene cada quince das en la parroquia Caldern de la ciudad de Portoviejo, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cra de animales y a la venta de sus productos.
En este lugar conocimos a la seora Florecilda, tiene 41 aos de edad, est casada y de esta relacin tienen tres hijos de 19, 15 y 13 aos de edad, todos estudian en universidad el mayor y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
Ella y su esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos venden calzado de todo tipo para lo cual los fines de semana instalan dos puestos uno en Caldern y otro en la ciudad de Santa Ana, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que mientras ella se encarga de vender con uno de sus hijos en Caldern su esposo en la madrugada parte hasta Santa Ana con otro de sus hijos para as aprovechar los das de feria en estos lugares que es cuando ms ventas realizan. Ellos comprar en Guayaquil a comerciantes mayoristas que le dejan a muy buen precio. Llevan en este negocio 20 aos y les ha ido muy bien a pesar de la competencia.
Este crdito es para comprar zapatos y zapatillas de hombres y de damas. Lleva 7 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que ofrece la institucin.
Su sueo es tener un local en el centro de Portoviejo.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Amor y Paz' (Love and Peace) community bank meet in Caldern parish, in the city of Portoviejo. Most people in this area farm, raise animals and sell their products.
Here we meet 41-year-old Florecilda who is married and has three children who are 19, 15 and 13 years old. They are all studying. Her eldest is at university and the younger children are in high school. Her husband is a salesman.
Florecilda and her husband work in commerce. They both sell all kinds of footwear. On weekends, they set up two stalls: one in Caldern and the other in the town of Santa Ana. Our friend tells us that while she sells with one of her children on the stall in Caldern, her husband sets off early in the morning for Santa Ana with another of their children. They do this so that they can make the most of the market days in these places which is when they make most sales. They buy their merchandise from wholesalers in Guayaquil who offer them a very good price. They have been in this business for twenty years and they have done very well in spite of the competition.
Florecilda will use this loan to buy men's and women's shoes and sneakers. She has been working with her community bank for seven loan cycles and she likes it because of the benefits that the institution offers. Her dream is to have premises in the center of Portoviejo.

loan.use: to buy men's and women's shoes and sneakers

loan.name: Ana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Amor y Paz se rene cada quince das en la parroquia Caldern de la ciudad de Portoviejo, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cra de animales y a la venta de sus productos.
En este lugar vive la seora Ana. Tiene 47 aos de edad, est casada y de esta relacin tiene tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad. Su esposo es comerciante.
Nuestra amiga se dedica junto a su esposo a la compra y venta de productos agrcolas, tamarindo cocinado por libras, man en grano y molido, achiote y otros productos ms al por mayor y menor. Trabajan todos los das de 4 h00 hasta las 15h00, nos cuenta que ellos adems de vender por la zona en la que viven tambin se desplazan a otras ciudades como Manta, Portoviejo y Quevedo, lugares donde venden a muy buen precio sus productos. Los productos para la venta los compran a los agricultores de la zona, luego ella los procesa y despus los llevan a entregar.
Este crdito lo va a utilizar en comprar man, tamarindo y achiote para la venta. Est en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta por los beneficios que reciben del banco.
Su meta es comprarce un carro para realizar sus ventas con ms comodidad.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Amor y Paz (Love and Peace) meets every 15 days in the parish of Caldern in the city of Portoviejo. Most of the people who live in this area engage in agriculture, raising animals, and selling their products.

Sra. Ana lives in this place. She is 47 years old, married, and has three grown children. Her husband is a merchant.

Ana and her husband buy and sell agricultural products such as cooked tamarind by the pound, whole and ground peanuts, annatto, and many other products in bulk and in smaller amounts. They work every day from 4am to 3pm. Ana says that they sell in the area where they live, but they also travel to other cities such as Manta, Portoviejo, and Quevedo where they can sell their products at a very good price. Ana and her husband buy their products from local farmers and she is in charge of processing them before they are sold.

This loan will be used to buy peanuts, tamarind, and annatto for eventual resale. Ana has been with the Communal Bank since the beginning and she enjoys the benefits that she has received. Her goal is to buy car so that she can make her sales much more comfortably.

loan.use: to buy peanuts, tamarind, and annatto.

loan.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es: La seora Demetria pertenece al grupo Azucenas ellas eligieron ese nombre ya que azucena es una flor muy bonita y el grupo est integrado por puras mujeres esa es la razn por la que eligieron ese nombre. Ella cuenta con 36 aos de edad es casada, tiene 6 hijos los cuales 5 dependen de ella, Vctor estudia medio superior, Oswaldo y Jorge estudian la secundaria, Yeimi y Diego estudian la primaria, Su esposo se llama Alfonso es albail. Ella se dedica al comercio tiene un pequeo negocio de pan el cual lo ha sacado adelante y espera que con la ayuda del prstamo vaya creciendo un poco ms su prstamo lo invirti en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para elaborar el pan como son: aceite, harina, manteca, lea, etc. Ella tiene una gran meta de hacer crecer su negocio convertirla en una panadera para darle un buen servicios a sus clientes. Ella pertenece al grupo de azucenas que est integrado por 12 miembros los cuales son mencionada. La Sra. Delfina se dedica al comercio en la venta de pollo, invirti su prstamo en la compra de pollos. La Sra. Edilberta se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras, ella invirti su prstamo en la compra de verduras y frutas como son: chile, jitomate, manzana, pltano. La Sra. Alberta se dedica al comercio de refrescos, ella invirti su prstamo en la compra ms refrescos de varios sabores. La Sra. Aurelina se dedica al comercio de comida, ella invirti su prstamo en la compra de insumos que utiliza para elaborar la comida como son: aceite, verduras, carne, pollo, tortillas. La Sra. Maribel se dedica al comercio de venta de comida, invirti su prstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para la elaboracin de comida como son: verduras, aceite, carne, etc. La Sra. Alejandrina se dedica al comercio de ropa, ella invirtio su prestamo en la compra de mas modelos de pantalones, faldas, blusas, etc. La sra. Dionicia se dedica al comercio de productos de limpieza los cual invirti su prstamo en mas productos. La Sra. Constantina se dedica al comercio de refresco, ella invirti su prstamo en la compra de as refrescos de distintos sabores y jugos. La Sra. Juvencia se dedica al comercio de ropa, ella invirti ms ropa por la temporada de feria. La Sra. Roxana se dedica al comercio ella vende comida lo cual invirti su prstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para hacer la comida. La Sra. Lorenza se dedica al comercio de carnicera, invirti su prstamo en la compra de puercos para matar y vender la carne. La Sra. Aurelina no se encuentra en la foto porque tenia un pediente en la escuela de su hijo.
texts.en:
Demetria belongs to the Azucenas (Lilies) group. They chose this name because azucena is a very pretty flower, and the group is comprised of all women. That is the reason they selected this name. She is 36 years old, married, and has six children. Five of the children are dependent upon her. Vctor is in high school, Oswaldo and Jorge are in middle school, and Yeimi and Diego are in elementary school. Her husband, Alfonso, is a bricklayer.
She has a small business selling bread, and she has gotten ahead in her business. She hopes that with the help of the loan it will go on growing a bit more. She will use the loan to buy bread making supplies like oil, flour, lard, and firewood, etc. She has a big goal of making her business grow and converting it to a bakery in order to give her customers good service. She belongs to the Azucenas group, which is comprised of 12 members mentioned below.
Delfina sells chicken and will use her loan to buy chickens.
Edilberta sells fruits and vegetables and will use her loan to buy fruits and vegetables like chilis, tomatoes, apples, and bananas.
Alberta sells soft drinks and will use her loan to buy more soft drinks of different flavors.
Aurelina sells food and will use her loan to buy supplies like oil, vegetables, meat, chicken, and tortillas.
Maribel sells food and will use her loan to buy supplies like vegetables, oil, and meat, etc.
Alejandrina sells clothes and will use her loan to buy more pants, skirts, and blouses, etc.
Dionicia sells cleaning products and will use her loan for more products.
Constantina sells soft drinks and will buy different flavors of soft drinks and juices.
Juvencia sells clothes and will buy more clothes for the fair season.
Roxana sells food and will buy ingredients she uses to make food.
Lorenza is a butcher and will use the loan to buy pigs to kill and sell their meat.
Aurelina is not in the photo because she had a matter to tend to at her sons school.

loan.use: to buy bread making supplies like oil, flour, lard, and firewood, etc.

loan.name: Cesar

texts.es: El seor Cesar es padre D. familia se distingue por ser muy responsable con sus obligaciones ya que tiene que dar el ejemplo a sus 4 hijos. Esta solicitando un prstamo ya que tiene gastos escolares, que es comprar tiles escolares que son cuadernos, carpetas, libros, plumas y lpices. Cesar por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar estos gastos, y no quiere que sus hijos se queden sin su material didctico ya que es L. forma que podrn recibir una mejor educacin y un mejor porvenir para el futuro. Para poder sostener los gastos del hogar trabaja en una maquiladora D. L. ciudad y su esposa le ayuda con los gastos realizando L. actividad D. empleada domestica.
texts.en:
Sr. Cesar is a father who has distinguished himself as being very responsible with his obligations so that he can set an example for his four children.

He is requesting a loan to buy school supplies. Cesar plans to purchase notebooks, folders, books, pens, and pencils. At the moment, he does not have the necessary funds to pay for these expenses but he does not want his children to go without the materials that will help them receive a better education and have better prospects for the future. In order to proviD. for the household expenses, Cesar works at a factory in the city and his wife helps out through her job as a housekeeper.

loan.use: to pay for his children's school supplies.

loan.name: Ma De Los Angeles

texts.es: La seora Ma de los ngeles es una mujer muy emprendedora que a pesar de la situacin econmica que esta en el pas, cuenta con su negocio de venta de ropa usada de buena calidad que ofrece a sus amistades y vecinos aun bajo precio. Ma de los ngeles es una seora grande de edad, la cual no la detiene seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta y ser dependiente de si misma. El negocio ha permanecido 5 aos por la atencin que ofrece y amabilidad al atender a sus clientes, esta es parte de su fuente de ingresos a parte la que su esposo gana como agricultor. Para que el negocio siga generando ingresos necesita comprar ropa de temporada.
texts.en:
Despite the financial situation that has impacted her country, Sra. Ma de los ngeles is an enterprising woman who has a business selling used clothes of good quality to her friends and neighbors at a low price. Even though she is an older woman, Ma de los ngeles continues to work because she enjoys what she does and has people who are depending on her.

She has been in business for five years, managing her inventory and serving her customers with friendliness. This business provides part of her income since her husband works as a farmer. She wants her business to continue generating income, so she needs to buy seasonal clothing.

loan.use: to purchase seasonal clothing.

loan.name: Martha

texts.es: La seora Martha cuenta con su negocio de miscelnea desde hace 1 ao donde ofrece variedad de producto y marca de buena calidad. Es una mujer muy emprendedora que le gusta manejar el negocio con mucha amabilidad para que sus clientes tengan una buena impresin de la atencin otorgada. Martha es madre de un pequeo de 3 aos al que quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida, como ella es grande de edad no quiere dejar a su hijo desamparado por ello trabaja mucho para dejarle un mejor patrimonio. El negocio es su nica fuente de ingreso por tal motivo quiere comprar mercanca como lcteos, refrescos, botanas, abarrote en general para tenerlo mas surtido, de esta manera obtendr mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha has a variety store where she has been selling high quality products of different brands for one year. She is an enterprising woman who enjoys managing her business. Martha demonstrates great kindness to her customers and they always leave with a good impression from the service she provides. Martha is the mother of a three-year-old son and wants to provide him a better quality of life. Since she is much older, Martha does not want to leave her son helpless so she works hard to provide him a nice inheritance.

This business is her only source of income. For this reason, she wants to buy merchandise such as dairy products, soft drinks, snacks, and groceries so that she can have more items in stock and generate more income.

loan.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loan.name: Los Claveles 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana enjoys working both at home and in her business. She is a member of a group named Los Claveles, or The Carnations. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable.

Ana is excited to be participating in her first group loan with Esperanza. Her group is dedicated to doing business around its community and other villages selling such things as food, clothes, shoes, cosmetics, underwear and many other products.

Ana started selling boiled beans three months ago. She now sells boiled beans (like the ones that are canned) and fried rounds maD. of flour, a very popular item especially in fried food stalls. She will use her portion of this loan to buy beans, flour, cooking oil, butter, eggs, ham, cheese, charcoal, etc.

Ana plans to reinvest her profits in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loan.use: to buy beans, flour, cooking oil, charcoal, etc.

loan.name: Monte De Bendicion 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Midely is a member of her group "Monte D. Bendicion" (Mount of Blessing). Her group is located in the area surrounding Santo Domingo, one of the poorest area in the capital where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable.
Midely is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She will use this loan to buy underwear and pants (women's and men's). She is taking this loan to start her business. She was invited to join this group because the other members knew that Miledy was wondering how to start a business but she was needing capital to begin. She is using her business profits to reinvest in her business.
Midely makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and her child. She says that her biggest challenge is to finish building her house. She said her most favorite activity is walking with her son. She dreams of having her house built and living safe and tranquil. She thanks you all for your support.

loan.use: to buy underwear and pants.

loan.name: Hul

texts.en:
This borrower is Hul, from Kompong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is 29 years old and is married with one child who lives under her care. Presently, Hul works as a tailor in a market near her village. She earns approximately 3 USD daily and has had her business since 2000. Hul has a lot of experience as a tailor and has a good reputation along with a deep understanding of local consumer needs. Her shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.
Hul would like to expand her business and purchase more cloth, but she lacks capital. She is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner HKL to purchase materials. Her future goals are to increase her profits to provide a better life for her whole family and she wishes to send her child to get a good education and have a better job and future.

loan.use: to purchase cloth

loan.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is 60 years old and lives in Medallo, Sapang Dalaga. He is married with eight children.
Edgardo has a shop that sells charcoal. He has had this business for 28 years. He requested a loan to purchase charcoal for his retail business.
Edgardo has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loan.use: To purchase charcoal for his retail business.

loan.name: Satya Laksana Group

texts.en:
The Satya Laksana group got a loan for the 4th time. The number of members is 14 and the total loan amounts to Rp.21,000,000. Having been successful with maintaining one sow, Ni Ketut will use this loan to purchase four types of local pigs for pork. She will maintain them for two months. Any remainder of the loan will be used to fix the cage for the preparation of new deliveries of two sows that she already owns.
The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but Ni Ketut remains optimistic about her business going forward. With all the benefits she gets, she plans to repair the home and also save for the future of her family.

loan.use: To purchase four types of local pigs.

loan.name: Sheila

texts.en:
At the age of 35, Sheila already has two children ages 16 and 13 who attend school. To generate income, Sheila sells beauty products from a catalog to her customers in the village. Her spouse also works as a local farmer.
She is now asking for a loan of P3,000 to buy cologne, lotion, powder and cosmetics to sell in the village. It would help increase her sales.
In the future, she would like to continue growing as an entrepreneur and enable her family to live comfortably.

loan.use: to buy cologne, lotion, powder and cosmetics to sell in the village.

loan.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Ornlong Veng District, Odor Meancheay Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer who earns a small daily income. Her husband is a soldier who must pay for a daily taxi to commute to his workplace. Chan and her husband have discussed this financial problem and she is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner HKL to purchase a motorbike. This lovely couple hopes that this loan will decrease their monthly expenses and allow them to gain more profit. They are very grateful to all the kind donors who provide funds to their family.

loan.use: to purchase a motorbike

loan.name: Tol

texts.en:
Mrs. Tol is a 38-year-old married woman who currently resides in Baray District of Kompong Tom Province. She is married to Mr. Ry and they have 2 children. The children are single, but one of them is now living apart from the family, working as a laborer in Korea.
Presently, Tol and her husband are cultivators as well as fishermen. They can earn about 8 USD per day to support their family's living condition. She would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva in order to purchase a piece of fertile land to enlarge her farming business both in rainy and dry seasons.
From her loan, Tol hopes that shell use the increased income to expand her house size and send her youngest child to be educated in a university and earn a degree.

loan.use: to purchase a piece of fertile land

loan.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 39 years old and a married woman having three children. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for 18 years. According to her, she is in charge of caring for their children because her husband is away due to his work. She would like to improve her hog-raising business to be able to provide for the needs of her children and send them to higher levels of education.
Sonia would like to make her dreams come true by asking for additional working capital amounting to P6,000. This amount would really help her to attain her dream in life. She will be using her requested loan in buying feed for her piglets. She hopes that her raised piglets will sell for a higher price so that she can cover their daily needs and pay their monthly electric bills.

loan.use: to buy feed for her hog-raising business.

loan.name: Zholdoshbek

texts.en: Zholdoshbek is a 41-year-old farmer, living with his family in the Zhergetal village (Northern Kyrgyzstan). He is raising five school-age children: three sons and two daughters. In search of sources of income for his family, Zholdoshbek started a business of fattening up and reselling livestock in 1993. Starting with a sum of 3,000 som (KGS), Zholdoshbek was able to develop his farm to have a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS). Also, Zholdoshbek's wife, Aynagul, is involved in retail sales at a small food stall, and this brings in additional income for the family. To further develop his business, Zholdoshbek requested a loan in the of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase livestock. He plans to use the profits from this loan to build a big house for his family.

loan.use: to purchase livestock

loan.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 35 years old and lives with her three school-aged children in the province of Isabela. Maribel describes herself as being an exacting, punctual woman.
She works with the help of her husband in her store, a business she started twenty years ago. She is requesting a loan of 22,000 PHP. The loan shes requesting at present is to buy merchandise for her store. With this supply of merchandise she will increase sales and income at the same time. Her dream is to enlarge the store, implementing more services to obtain higher income.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, spices and drinks for her store.

loan.name: Im

texts.en:
From Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh, Mrs. Im is a 60-year-old poor woman who tries to earn money to upgrade her standard of living. She has two single children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory as a domestic sewing worker and has a formal salary per month, while the other one is married and lives in a separate house.
Mrs. Im makes a daily income by selling different kinds of dry fish in the mobile place. From this, she is earning a profit approximately of 2.50 USD per day. She has many years experience in this business. As a result, she frequently gets more clients who come to order her dry fish to eat. She has a life partner in her husband who works in the construction field as a chief of building workers. In order to add extra-income, Mrs. Im would like to borrow some loan funds from Kiva to purchase additional dry fish to sell.
In the future plan, Mrs. Im will be using the net income to raise her current business, and also to decorate her old house.

loan.use: to purchase additional dry fish to sell

loan.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 58 years old with six grown-up children. Emerita has been selling groceries for over two years. She requests a loan of 11,000 PHP in order to purchase merchandise such as canned goods, candies, noodles and sugar.
She wishes to sell a wider variety of goods, because her customers have been asking for this kind of merchandise and it will be much better for her. This way she will get more income for her family and she will be able to provide education for her child who is a college student.
She plans to repay the loan with part of the profits she makes from her business, since it's her source of income.

loan.use: to buy bread, candies, canned goods, noodles and sugar.

loan.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is married with one child. Jaime is 45 years old and lives in Cabilinan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. To earn a living, Jaime is engaged in a transportation business, serving in his community and he had been in this kind of business for seven years. Each month, he earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of Php 12,000 to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle and a portion of his loan will go to purchase additional goods to sell in his sari-sari (general) store.
Jaime has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Jaime hopes to purchase another motorcycle for transport.
About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
GDMPC: people empowering people.

loan.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts.

loan.name: But

texts.en: Mrs. But is a young mother of two children. She is an honest and goal-oriented woman. She supports her children on her own and has a hard time satisfying all of the needs of her children, and always needs support. She decided to deal with these difficulties by getting involved in selling soft drinks, hard drinks, food products and grocery goods. To upgrade her living, Mrs. But wishes to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva. She will use this loan to purchase more goods to sell. She thanks everyone in advance for the support her business. The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.

loan.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loan.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul is the leader of this group. She is 47 and unfortunately she is a widow. She is bringing up a daughter and two sons; the younger son studies at school and the other children are at university. In order to earn money for their livelihood, Aigul sells fruits and vegetables. She started this activity eleven years ago with an initial investment of 3000 soms and at the moment her monthly profit is 6000 soms per month.
With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell. Aigul will use some part of the loan to pay her daughters tuition at university. In the future she wants to give her children a good education and wishes to build a new house.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loan.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loan.name: Delgersaihan

texts.en:
Delgersaihan is 42 years old and lives with his children and wife in a 'ger' in Hovd province of Mongolia. Three of his children are college students and one child is a high school student. His wife is selling dairy products, especially milk, for the fifth year.
Delgersaihan started his business in 2009 by selling wood and coal. Before that, he was a security guard. His business is very profitable during the wintertime and the dairy products trade is also profitable in summertime. He is a diligent man who says "Currently our expenses are quite high due to the college tuition fees of three children and other such costs. Thus, this loan will help me to manage these issues effectively." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase coal and wood and will store them while the demand and price are low.

loan.use: To purchase coal and wood.

loan.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is leading the agricultural business of the family, particularly in hog raising. She has had this business for four years and she is able to generate an income of P1,000 for each piglet. Aside from the hog raising business, she also has rice farming which is managed by her husband.
Teresita is requesting her ninth loan in the amount of P10,000 to purchase feed for the daily maintenance of her hogs.She needs to feed them three times a day so that she can sell them at a greater price. She plans to increase her profit in the hog raising business so that she can let her children finish their studies and sustain their daily needs.

loan.use: to purchase feed for the daily maintenance of her hogs.

loan.name: Boldoo

texts.en:
Boldoo is forty years old and lives with his five children and wife in a ger in Hovd province in Mongolia. His wife stays at home, his eldest daughter has a part-time job, and his other daughter is a college student. One son is a high school student and the other attends kindergarten. He is a diligent and accountable man.

Boldoo started a carpentry business in 2008. In 2010 he bought a car and became a taxi driver. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase car repair equipment and materials so as to build a body shop.

Boldoo says, "There are many people who have body shops at their homes. I also have learned that a taxi service brings in a sufficient and consistent amount of income daily. Thus, I want to combine these two efficiently and offer the best quality service to my clients."

In the future, Boldoo plans to open a car body shop at his place.

loan.use: to purchase car repair equipment and materials.

loan.name: Misiratkhan's Group

texts.en:
Misiratkhan is fifty and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised a son and five daughters. The son is a farmer, two younger daughters work in Russia and the other daughters are married and live separately with their families.

Misiratkhan farms rice and corn as well as breeding and reselling livestock after fattening them. In this way she earns money to meet the familys daily needs.
